title: Forgot the full account name
content:

But one day, either I logged out myself, or the system threw me out of that mail. I'm trying to recover my mail by trying on the correct password and email, but I don't remember my full name and most likely because of this I can't log back in.

Will any of the moderators be able to contact me via another rambler email so that I can provide the email I'm having problems with? This mail is important to me now. I don't know exactly what happened to the mail, I just can't log in to it.

title: Unable to send emails on Thunderbird
content: Hello. My name is Chris Bottle and I live in Australia. In the last couple of days I've discovered that I'm unable to send emails. I've checked my IMAP settings are they are all correct. My email provider is Telstra Australia. When I send an email I get a reply back "An error occured while sending email. Outgoing server SMTP error. The server responded; Connection refused - OB119 .103.224.52.151 is blacklisted in Abusix Mail Intelligence and then two lines of text prefixed by https;/lookup.abusix and further text. I checked with Telstra and after much checking they could find nothing their end. I'm not that computer literate and freely admit that this problem has bamboozled me. I hope somebody can help with this problem. Many thanks. Cheers, Chris
creator: woftam02

title: TB 146.0.1 Spam Filter Not Learning / Broken
content: For about a month or more I can right-click on a spam message, select Mark as Spam and the message disappears to the Spam folder as expected. But, two days later a message from the same sender comes into my mail. This used to work very well but not now. I am using SpamAssassin. Items that match a manual add stay in my IN folder but are marked in the text as suspected spam - they are not moved automatically until I open them up. Spam filtering is broken.
creator: radiowhiz

title: Thunderbird often hangs for a brief period after upgrading to Tahoe (bug1998881)
content:
It's hard to pin down when exactly it will happen but Thunderbird regularly freezes from roughly 10~15 seconds after clicking the red close button. In that time TB doesn't allow the desktop or any other app to become active until it finishes whatever it's doing. The bug occurs after I've brought it to the front and then close it. For example, an email just arrived so I checked that then closed TB. That's when it hung.

I've found it also happens after discarding a draft so that I'm unable to open or even highlight other emails in my Inbox for a short time. This hanging started happening right after I upgraded to Mac OS X 26.2 a few weeks ago. So far I've tried...

1) Troubleshoot Mode. No change. Even with no extensions or themes installed the problem shows up. 2) Increased the value of mail.db.idle_limit 10X to 3000000. 3) Did a clean reinstall of the app (v146.0.1). I redid Settings from scratch and imported emails from a previous installation. The size of the Profiles folder is 991MB. 4) no anti-virus software is installed.

It's similar to this bug. I made a comment there 2-3 weeks ago but no reply so far. https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1998881

Also similar to this... But I don't have a calendar installed. https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=2000460

Not sure what else to try. Any suggestions?
creator: gh108

title: Junk folder disappeared after an HTML warning
content:
I am running Thunderbird 140.6.0esr on a Windows 10 desktop PC. Yesterday I was accessing my inbox and had a problem. I marked a message as Junk in the message bar. Then the Junk folder disappeared from my folder list and now pressing Junk for a message causes no action. Before the Junk folder disappeared it had 2 unread messages.

My Junk settings say "Junk" folder on: my account name.

I do not know how to proceed. Please help.

title: " abuse opion"
content: While registrating an android handy from Samsung and also registrating and activating a SIM card to be able to use a telephone again - the last one died suddenly - I made some experiences with the Google AI - ... that caused me to cry out for Help with Mozilla. (german is my language, so please have patience). I am a private connaisseur of the worldwide web, never used social networks, I read some things about it, when facebook was started - I do not use a digital purse (even if it was handy to.) I studied art, worked long, exiting and exhausting Years for the film business. mostly artdirection, set design. My MACs-computer and laptops where allways of wonderfull help. To the Case: In the Process of registration and activation of the 2 items, the Ai was not shure, I was not a child. For learning reasons, to make them better (for us?), they bound me to their observation. I thought, it was not so bad, because I could get some learning myself of android-language and some personal experience with Ai (New Romancer. You know that sci-fi ). After a short while - in my scedule it also became a question of digital identification, to make them believe, who I am. In the end, when they decided in their experimental mood, they would limit me futher by cutting me from my network - small, regional, open, not so safe, I am sure - with problems on the connectionside - my Entrance to the web is called " hamburg.freifunk.net "- I sat at my table and clicked the WLAN Button as soon as I saw it deactivate. It was a long, fast battle. I deactivated the mobile. I could not connect you in the adequate way. sorry. question: why don`t you have a field on your startpage that directs the idiot to an sos field for urgent information in clearspeach and their cry for help? When I started again - they put language on the surface, what I could not move away, it was not possible to use some language-buttons underneath or choose in the "einstellungen". The whole time i saw the smallWLAN sign in the r. upper corner. I have to set back the whole thing anyway. To get your digital ident., according to germ. law and to technical spec. The"selbstgewählte" passwort/systemeinst. with "at least 1 letter and all-in all more than 4 signs" MUST have 6 dig. - mine had seven. xx
